formattedAddress: 1467 York Ave, New York, NY 10075, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1467 York Ave, New York, NY 10075-8803, USA

editorialSummary.text: Relaxed eatery serving straightforward Chinese food such as General Tso's chicken & crab rangoon.

originalText.text:
First time trying the restaurant, looking for some Chinese food. Ordered the hot and sour soup and miso soup. Both were pretty yummy and soothing on a rainy day.

For entrees, got the honey walnut shrimp and the mapo tofu.

The honey walnut shrimp was not what I was used to or expecting. The breading was a bit crunchier, closer to popcorn shrimp. The sauce was not fully incorporated and kind of half mixed, half on top. The flavor was good and the shrimp was cooked real well; I am just used to a more creamy and less thick sauce. I would probably get it again if I was craving it!

The mapo tofu was also different. It was spicy but not super deep in flavor. The sauce was a good consistency but I would've ordered more black bean sauce and more ground pork. Overall, it went well with the rice just need a bit more.

It's in a convenient location and I would definitely come back to try some of their other dishes and the lunch special. The service was really nice and made the experience worth it.

Oh, plus you get free wonton chips with a sweet and sour sauce so that's kind of nice.

originalText.text: A longtime neighborhood fixture, Hunan offers typical Chinese-American fare (meaning many dishes have copious amounts of thick brown sauce).  I personally ask them to reduce the amount of sauce or even do a dry-sauté style. They also offer Japanese food but I’d stick to the Chinese food. Lunch specials start at $11.70 (tax included).

I personally ask them to reduce the amount of sauce or even do a dry-sauté style. They also offer Japanese food but I’d stick to the Chinese food. Lunch specials start at $11.70 (tax included).

originalText.text: A super-cozy, absolutely delicious spot for Chinese food. Has always been one of my very favorite go-to spots for comforting food and a warm, quiet atmosphere. The Cantonese noodle soups are particularly good, as well as the Mapo Tofu and all the classic dishes. Definitely don’t miss this wonderful place!

text.text: A super-cozy, absolutely delicious spot for Chinese food. Has always been one of my very favorite go-to spots for comforting food and a warm, quiet atmosphere. The Cantonese noodle soups are particularly good, as well as the Mapo Tofu and all the classic dishes. Definitely don’t miss this wonderful place!

originalText.text: It's a good neighborhood Chinese/Asian fusion restaurant. The staff is friendly and the food is prompt. They're willing to cook special orders. The food isn't the spicyest but it's still good.

text.text: It's a good neighborhood Chinese/Asian fusion restaurant. The staff is friendly and the food is prompt. They're willing to cook special orders. The food isn't the spicyest but it's still good.

originalText.text:
We ate here frequently until recently.
THE FOOD HAS GONE DOWNHILL.

I ordered Gen Tso chicken. It was deep fried, not sautéed. It looked so bad one of my friends didn't believe it was Gen Tso Chicken.

We called over the manager- she  claimed this was prepared correctly.
I left it over. They wrapped it. On the way out I handed it to the manager& said please throw this out. We will never come back.

She said thank you & lost 2 customers.

Another customer was complaining when we walked in.

So sad when you see one of your favorite restaurants go downhill. Maybe they can't afford the same quality food.

The restaurant was empty- only 1 other customer.... I think they must be having troubles.
